page.title: 07ST.FAITH'S CHURCH OVERBURY
page.content: St.Faith's Church,Overbury,is quite large for the size of the village. It is rectangular in shape and has a Bell Tower.It is an old church,the nave being the oldest part,built in the time of the{Normans.}The rest of the building is between five and eight hundred years old.There is a very {Ancient Stone Font}with some interes- ting carvings on it.{Two Consecration {Crosses}painted in red,dating from the middle ages,can still be seen on the walls of the chancel.We all walked around the church to an outside door to climb up the Bell Tower.The stairs were very steep,narrow and winding. We felt excited and scared, our legs felt shaky like jelly.The bells were bigger than we expected. It was a relief to reach the top. The village looked very different from above.Most of us found it even worse going back down.
